notes.text:
An update for microcode_ctl is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.2 Advanced Update Support.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic
Details

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in Intel's implementation of RAPL (Running Average Power Limit).  An attacker with a local account could query the power management functionality to intelligently infer SGX enclave computation values by measuring power usage in the RAPL subsystem.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: hw: Information disclosure issue in Intel SGX via RAPL interface
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

Until a firmware update and reboot can be applied, the attack vector can be reduced by limiting read access to the sysfs attributes that export this functionality to userspace.  

The command:
~~~
sudo chmod 400 /sys/class/powercap/intel_rapl/*/energy_uj
~~~
Will do this for the current boot, it will need to be scripted to run at each boot to remain persistent across reboots.

vulnerabilities.title: hw: Information disclosure issue in Intel SGX via RAPL interface

cwe.name: Improper Removal of Sensitive Information Before Storage or Transfer

notes.text: A flaw was found in the Intel Advanced Vector Extensions (AVX) implementation, where a local authenticated attacker with the ability to execute AVX instructions can gather the AVX register state from previous AVX executions. This vulnerability allows information disclosure of the AVX register state.

cwe.name: Improper Removal of Sensitive Information Before Storage or Transfer

notes.text: A flaw was found in the CPU microarchitecture where a local attacker is able to abuse a timing issue which may allow them to infer internal architectural state from previous executions on the CPU.
